title: What are the best books about data science? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi there, I guess this is one of the most widespread questions doing rounds of the data driven world. And why not -- with so many books available both off line and online – one could easily get spoiled for choices. But worry not, as I will share some of the best books, which were recommended to me by my seniors when I was starting out my data science career and then few of them were suggested when I was working as a junior data scientist in a firm. So without a further ado… here’s my list of best books that you should start reading!  Some books for aspiring data science professionals or beginners – The Data Science Handbook: Advice and Insights from 25 Amazing Data Scientists by Carl Shan, William Chen, Henry Wang, and Max SongDoing Data Science: Straight Talk from the Frontline by Cathy O'Neil and Rachel SchuttData Science for Dummies by Lillian PiersonThe Art of Data Science by Roger D. Peng and Elizabeth MatsuiNumsense! Data Science for the Layman: No Math Added by Annalyn Ng and Kenneth SooWhile there are numerous other books for beginners the above-mentioned books would help you prepare for your data science journey. Now I will share some of the books that could be considered as classics in the world of data science. Naked Statistics: Stripping the Dread from the Data by Charles WheelanPractical Statistics for Data Scientists: 50+ Essential Concepts Using R and Python by Peter Bruce, Andrew Bruce, Peter GedeckPractical Data Science with R by Nina ZumelPattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Christopher M. BishopDeep Learning with Python by François CholletSome other books (for both beginners and seasoned professionals) that you could read include – Data Science and Big Data Analytics: Discovering, Analyzing, Visualizing, and Presenting Data by John Wiley & SonsBayesian Methods for Hackers: Probabilistic Programming and Bayesian Inference by Cam Davidson-PilonDesigning Data-Intensive Applications: The Big Ideas Behind Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Systems by Martin KleppmannThese are some of the best books that are available in the market about Data Science. I hope you would enjoy reading them as much as I enjoyed reading them.

I'm compiling a bunch of free data science books as a public resource. Here's all the books I have right now: All of these books have (authorized) free digital versions, or are pay what you want (PWYW) with $0 minimum. Programming for Data Science R Programming for Data Science (PWYW)Think Python by Allen Downey (free)More resources: How do I learn Python?, R (programming language): How do I learn R? Statistics and Bayesian Data Analysis Statistical Inference for Data Science (PWYW)Think Stats by Allen Downey (free)Think Bayes by Allen Downey (free)Probabilistic Programming and Bayesian Methods for Hackers (free)More resources: How do I learn Bayesian inference as a beginner? Experimental Design and Analysis (aka A/B Testing) A First Course in Design and Analysis of Experiment (free)More resources: How do I learn experimental design? Statistical Machine Learning Introduction to Statistical Learning (free)The Elements of Statistical Learning (free)More resources: How do I learn machine learning? The Data Science Process The Elements of Data Analytic Style (PWYW)Data Visualization Interactive Data Visualization for the Web (free online)d3 Tutorials (many free)Interviews with Data ScientistsDespite the similar name, these two books are not officially affiliated, although some of the authors know each other well! These books contains interviews of data scientists, and give some good insight into their careers, their stories, and what they do! The Data Science Handbook (PWYW) (disclosure - this is my book!)The Data Analytics Handbook (free)More resources: What does a data scientist do? Build a Data Science TeamThese are all O'Reilly mini-books that are officially released for free online. Data Driven: Creating a Data Culture by Hilary Mason and DJ Patil (free)Understanding the Chief Data Officer (free)Building Data Science Teams by DJ Patil (free)More resources: How do I build a data science team? Suggestions for more free data science books are always welcome! Come back to this answer to find out when I launch the webpage or to see me expand the list.
